content:
Why Millets Matter Today

Millets have re-emerged as supergrains thanks to their mineral density, gluten-free nature, and sustainable farming footprint. In Ayurveda, they are light and ideal for balancing Kapha, especially in sedentary lifestyles.

Which Millets Are in This Mix?

  • Finger Millet (Ragi): Rich in calcium and iron.
  • Barnyard Millet: Light and easy to digest.
  • Ragi: Excellent for steady energy.
  • Amla Powder: Adds natural vitamin C and preservation.

How to Use This Flour

Make rotis, dosas, bread, pancakes, or porridge. Adding warm water or a bit of oil helps bind dough better since these grains are gluten-free.

Ayurvedic Recipe Ideas

  • Millet pancakes with ghee and cardamom.
  • Soft millet rotis with sesame oil.
  • Breakfast porridge with warm spices.

Why Ayurveda Loves Millets

They keep Kapha in balance, provide slow-release energy, and support digestion without heaviness.
